messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `CommentController` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `CommentController`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

{'stdout': 'app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php:10:class CommentController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php:12:class CommentController extends Controller
app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php:12:class CommentController extends Controller
', 'stderr': ''}

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files (paths relative to the project root) that contain CommentController implementations:

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php

Explanation:

- routes/admin.php imports App\Http\Controllers\Admin\CommentController, so the controller that will handle the admin /comments resource is implemented at app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php. That file defines the admin handlers used by the admin routes (methods: index, edit, update, destroy), which match the resource routes limited in routes/admin.php -> only(['index','edit','update','destroy']).

- The other two files also define classes named CommentController but in different namespaces:
  - app/Http/Controllers/CommentController.php is the public/web CommentController (handles storing and Turbo Stream responses for front-end comment creation and deletion).
  - app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php is the API CommentController (handles index, show, destroy for the API).
  These are separate classes and are not the controller referenced by routes/admin.php (because routes/admin.php specifically imports the Admin namespace).
